page.title: 06Rainhill Hospital.
page.content: Rainhill Hospital was built as a lunatic asylum for long-term patients. The building is in two parts:Avon wing and Sherdley wing. The latter has newly built Scott Clinic, a secure building for dangerous patients such as murderers. The Benedict Clinic is for the cure of alcoholics. Once a patient shows signs of recovery they are allowed to re-enter the community. They can live in flats near the hospital and return each day for special medication. Their part of the hospital is called Elton Vale. There, Occupational Therepy is attempted by providing instruction in life-skills such as cooking, shopping and handicrafts. On occasions, depressed patients kill themselves in the area. Some disturbed patients wander into the village where they sometimes frighten children.
